timeline.message:
dependency: bump maven-dependency-plugin from 3.1.1 to 3.1.2

Bumps [maven-dependency-plugin](https://github.com/apache/maven-dependency-plugin) from 3.1.1 to 3.1.2.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/apache/maven-dependency-plugin/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/apache/maven-dependency-plugin/compare/maven-dependency-plugin-3.1.1...maven-dependency-plugin-3.1.2)

Signed-off-by: dependabot-preview[bot] <support@dependabot.com>

timeline.bodyText: Please add a second finalize method but with parameters, there should not be a violation for it.
timeline.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: Please put // Violation at the end of line where the actual violation occurs.
timeline.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: Missed few whitespaces, please format it correctly.
timeline.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: Don't use these tags here. Please take a look at other pull requests and update it accordingly.
timeline.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: The object parameter is missing here.
timeline.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText: I think it is fine, it is a call to original finalize()
replies.author: rdiachenko

replies.bodyText: so, should i add it? and if yes, why?
replies.author: OmarShawky1

replies.bodyText:
I think it is fine, it is a call to original finalize()

A call to original finalize()? A quote from the Check description: Finalizers are unpredictable, often dangerous, and generally unnecessary. Their use can cause erratic behavior, poor performance, and portability problems.
The example should do not call the original finalize. And finalize(object) is not a finalizer. It is just a method with a poorly chosen name. It has nothing to do with GC so it is OK to call.
replies.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText: i think this is a syntax error as this class is not inheriting 'finalizer(Object object)'
replies.author: OmarShawky1

replies.bodyText:
The example should do not call the original finalize

@pbludov , could you explain why? I thought the purpose of the whole NoFinalizerCheck check is to complain if you override the original finalize method (the first method above) but in the second method above you just call the original finalize. So, why there should not be a call to original finalize from another method?
replies.author: rdiachenko

replies.bodyText:
i think this is a syntax error as this class is not inheriting 'finalizer(Object object)'

Why? finalize is not a reserved word. The example shows just a method with name finalize. This method is not called by GC.
Maybe the OK example should be just dropped, as it is already confusing people.
@rdiachenko, what are you think? The Check is not expected to have a valid case.
replies.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText: If it confuses people I'm fine to remove this case. @OmarShawky1 could you please leave a finalize method with violation only?
replies.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: remove one whitespace to correct indentation
timeline.author: rdiachenko

timeline.bodyText: Please remove object argument. The code doesn't compile with it.
timeline.author: rdiachenko
